document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Netelia ( Bessobates ) pallescens :
Oelke & Townes, 1969
: 404
;
Delrio, 1975
: 68
;
Tolkanitz, 1981 b
: 123
;
Kasparyan & Tolkanitz, 1999
: 173
.

subSubSection.paragraph: ♂. Head ( Figs 86, 87 ) 1.8–1.9 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view evenly rounded; occiput polished and impunctate; vertex and gena weakly and finely punctate; interocellar area polished with very sparse and weak punctures; geno-orbital index 2.2–2.7 ; frons impunctate and finely coriaceous, with a very weak median longitudinal groove; face 1.4–1.5 times as wide as long, punctate; supraclypeal suture distinct; clypeus 1.9–2.3 times as wide as long, rather more sparsely punctate than face, with apical margin truncate and medially slightly emarginate; antenna with 42–53 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.3–1.5 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.3–2.7 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.4 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 9.0– 10.4 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 24–33 pectines; hind tarsal claw with 14–26 pectines.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 86–90. Male of
Netelia
( Bessobates )
pallescens
. 86, Head in dorsal view; 87, head in frontal view; 88, mesosoma in dorsal view; 89, fore wing; 90, hind wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head yellow; antenna reddish-brown. Mesosoma yellow; mesoscutum with light brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes; scutellum, postscutellum and propodeum light brown; mesosternum and markings on mesopleuron brownish-yellow. Legs brownish-yellow; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing brownish-yellow, other veins blackish-brown. Metasoma light brown.

Distribution. Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu), Europe.

Remarks. This species belongs to the
virgata
group as stated in the remarks for
comitor
. This is the first record of this species from Japan .
